column4: hi room... can anyone help me here with mirror.list & sources.list errors ?
I have downloaded the repository on my HDD which I always do.... and configured accordingly... but somehow it doesn't work .... I mean updating the repo...
it says... no new updates.... and its been few months I have installed intrepid ...
what happens when you do sudo apt-get update?
it is picking up from the local repository
I need to update the local repository .... using apt-mirror... even then it says no new updates.....
change the servers in /etc/apt/sources.list manually or try changing them automatically with system > administration > software sources
or try changing the mirrors used by apt-mirror
this is what I have on my sources.list .... http://pastebin.com/pastebin.php?dl=m629749a3
I'm not sure, but to me it looks like it's set to mirror itself
this is what I did to redirect to my local repo .... sudo ln -sf /media/H-Drive-SATA116/Repository-intrepid/mirror/hyhhlnx0/ubuntu repo
hi ... can you suggest me a solution ???
reconfigure apt-mirror to mirror a different repository, or use apt with a remote repository instead of a local copy
well I guess I have to do that... till I figure out the issue with this.... anyway thanks for your help.... btw do you know about keryx  [ http://keryx.betaserver.org/ ] ???
